Michel Houellebecq Fot Mariusz Kubik 03.jpg | caption =Houellebecq in 2008 | birth_date = | birth_place = Saint-Pierre, RÃ©union | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Novelist, filmmaker and poet | movement = | website = }} Michel Houellebecq (; born Michel Thomas; 26 February 1956)Houellebecq was born in 1956, but gave out his birth year to be 1958, before it was revealed by a journalist. is a French author, filmmaker, and poet. His first book was a biographical essay on the horror writer H. P. Lovecraft. Houellebecq published his first novel, Whatever, in 1994. His next novels Atomised, published in 1998, and Platform followed in 2001 were also his best known works. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:French novelists Category:French poets
